title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions: In a large bowl, cream together the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until smooth.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla extract.
Dissolve baking soda in hot water and add it to the batter along with salt.
Mix in the flour until just blended.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 10 to 12 minutes, or until edges are golden brown.
notes: You can also add nuts or dried fruits to the cookie dough if desired.

title: Apple Cinnamon Pie
summary: A delicious homemade pie with a perfect balance of sweet apples and warm cinnamon flavors.

ingredients.name: pre-made pie crusts
ingredients.notes: for the bottom and top crusts

instructions: In a large bowl, combine the sliced apples, granulated sugar, flour, cinnamon, and salt. Toss everything together until the apples are evenly coated.
Place one pie crust into a 9-inch pie dish. Press it gently against the bottom and sides.
Pour the apple mixture into the pie crust, and dot the top with the small pieces of butter.

Roll out the second pie crust and place it on top of the apple filling. Trim any excess crust and seal the edges by crimping with your fingers or a fork. Cut a few small slits on the top crust to allow steam to escape.
Brush the top crust with milk and sprinkle granulated sugar over it.
Place the pie on a baking sheet and bake for about 50-60 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbling.
Remove the pie from the oven and let it cool on a wire rack for at least 2 hours before serving.
Serve the apple cinnamon pie on its own or with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
notes: For best results, choose a mix of tart and sweet apples such as Granny Smith and Honeycrisp. You can also adjust the amount of sugar and cinnamon according to your taste preference.
